alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 19 at 2:17PM PST until February 22 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 4500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 26 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades. * WHEN...From Monday evening through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow accumulations of up to 2 feet expected near Santiam Pass with 3 to 5 inches expected at elevations above 2500 ft.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades
